B0A34500A46E42ED84D18FFC9E526F1B.description: Reflect on personal linguistic and cultural identity.

307D67F5025C4CE1A19C693E07AE4453.description: Explore worldwide programming and initiatives that support German communities, programming and language.

3891198564FF423B88CA5F0457507B6B.description: Explore international career fields for which the ability to speak German is a requirement or an asset (e.g., the Red Cross, Olympics, United Nations, business, interpreter, international government, education, reporters and Doctors Without Borders).

038A419FD2B2495FAA649DCB81201FD4.description: Investigate international scholarship, study and travel opportunities available to German-speaking Canadian students.

5EAD36A202634C57945309DFFBCDA272.description: Research global opportunities to further personal German language learning (e.g., postsecondary programs, international cultural exchanges and organizations).

FBC2D3BE5D2642F0B1695C387BFF7AC8.description: Investigate opportunities to communicate in German at the global level (e.g., German social media groups, blogging, corresponding in German with people from various parts of the German-speaking world).

2E0E6950E62D4FB3B4AD53E6B2D91F28.description: Discuss the different linguistic and cultural perspectives on world issues (e.g., violence, sexuality, the environment and social media).

25731968D40C4A6C94D36B0173A4B02C.description: Explore international summer work opportunities and practicum placements for German-speaking students.

91BF388BD5D64BB89644477FC5212A07.description: Identify study opportunities at German-speaking universities and technical colleges (e.g., Deutsche Akademische Austauschdienst (DAAD) and Bundesverwaltungsamt Zentralstelle für das Auslandswesen) open to international students.

708C70EE81AD468EA84C1C9D6ABF6E4B.description: Explain how personal understanding of a culture might be enhanced through language learning.

61C7972FC081420D8AF3DA52F83845B7.description: Investigate international opportunities to use and develop German language skills and explore personal identity as a German language learner.

2499FABC3F7C400FB6E7D68B40876618.description: Articulate typical attitudes and cultural-linguistic world view of German speakers to issues such as: the Holocaust; the Cold War; the environment (e.g., recycling, nuclear and green energy and climate change); urban sprawl; public transportation; and, political organization and involvement.

4427F1DFEDBF44BB9B77CA9EC66FA2D7.description: Investigate the impact of German communities’ geographical locations on their local culture and ethnic diversity.

F36D775AC3D34F92A55AA5C7994816FB.description: Examine and compare elements of German culture and heritage (e.g., food, the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history) in various parts of the world.

6B1EEEB8AA1046A89CFBFB6873240EED.description: Inquire about German culture and heritage (e.g., the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history and food) in various parts of the world by: reading, listening to or viewing tourist information or facts about German-speaking countries or regions around the world; researching German events (e.g., Unity Day, Oktoberfest) and organizations; and, investigating cultural places or historic sites (e.g., Brandenburg Gate and Berlin Wall).

0D147F8BA3EB43E5B22DEBB9A96241BF.description: Analyze the economic impact of Germany within Europe and on other countries around the world.

102AF68AFB55429FA391848AE6410CE1.description: Discuss dialectical pronunciation and vocabulary differences within German and in standard usage in other parts of the world.

E8A86F45B6CA48BEA291985B2AF19984.description: Describe the traditional and cultural contributions of German-speakers (e.g., Martin Luther, Johann Sebastian Bach, Angela Merkel and Albert Einstein).

6B27478B7E9C4DD3A3D248552A3B12E0.description: Research significant historical (e.g., rise of German Nationalism, formation of Swiss Confederacy, Austro-Hungarian Empire, impacts of World Wars, fascism, the Holocaust, Cold War and the European Union) and contemporary events that affect German communities.

109F86374B6446779FBC763A8D37A975.description: Identify German-speaking countries (e.g., Germany, Austria, Belgium and Luxembourg) in the world.

A7495E5F5CF94D2092B6DB497267FBA2.description: Explore historical and contemporary elements, and the cultural and linguistic diversity, of German-speaking cultures around the world.

D40FB3D2C1E848D89B5BF27F0C289B87.description: Incorporate the following in written productions: evidence of planning (e.g., narrative writing organizers and bullet journals); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., introduction, development of ideas, conclusion and flow of ideas); appropriate tone; rich context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and, linguistic conventions.

ED3A3D2F7B04406EB9199A0CA0ADE845.description: Research, organize and present information in expository texts (e.g., biography on German artist and essay on traditional German foods).

A99A3F92BDFD4570AA163F748807E528.description: Experiment with a variety of text types (e.g., letters, schedules, lists, questionnaires, reports and social media posts).

EB8B64E2D1554476B0D3F3B993057A7A.description: Express personal opinions in a persuasive text (e.g., travel blogs and editorials).

D03EAC25EEF64893A7B06172888F28E1.description: Create a comic strip with German dialogue.

A580489F35814D73AAB26A7A3EA4AF37.description: Compose emails requesting information on topics related to future plans (e.g., travel or exchange possibilities, post-secondary education and career opportunities).

6E6662C94EE74634AAF464F782231C2B.description: Write a message to convey the details (e.g., time and location) of an appointment.

7C1D07861B4D4734927596289F73D2F6.description: Complete a questionnaire or résumé with relevant details (e.g., education, skills, work experience and interests).

07EEBC126B7C47D9B54D8A626DFC72FA.description: Produce a variety of written German texts related to big ideas such as: global German communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

6780DBA22EB348CB85E7A7A22586263D.description: Produce a variety of written non-fiction and fiction German texts to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

24212736E6EE49F69FA1B61E476BEFDF.description: Incorporate the following in oral productions: evidence of planning (e.g., narrative writing organizers and bullet journals); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., introduction, development of ideas, conclusion and flow of ideas); appropriate tone; rich context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and, linguistic conventions.

15FC366722B941A386EC7ABCC4DB749A.description: Present information on a topic of interest (e.g., sports, music and travel destination) using a variety of visuals (e.g., charts, maps, diagrams, pictures and gestures) while speaking.

D77E9B06D61F451D8226A48C9CE72D2D.description: Persuade audience of a perspective using convincing details and supporting arguments.

C36A7AA36155407CB32C5E67B519318C.description: Defend opinions with supporting arguments in a debate.

7139E6BEE4DC464F951EA7CEBC32A68A.description: Present stories, poetry and monologues with expression, intonation and enunciation.

803D9A38FC94481CBE35A6C73D03F4EC.description: Conduct an interview by posing, and responding to, direct questions.

71E5CF8B1690429E9A9E5A5DE6D73AD6.description: Provide detailed directions to a location.

5CD52AEFEF2C495F970EB278CED3E9B8.description: Relay basic information from English to short, simple German and vice versa in informal situations.

B5028AD513A6434D97A7A8890814D7C9.description: Experiment with oral language to communicate emotions, opinions and advice.

78D96E7C6C4347F8B79EBB95C0863410.description: Generate conversations by posing and responding to questions on a variety of topics, such as travel experiences, school aspirations and entertainment preferences.

7B095D8E77AD4DD98580B895152F5C30.description: Contribute to spontaneous conversations on familiar topics with multiple participants.

C23819C01BAB4BBDA383FA9A955956EC.description: Produce a variety of oral German texts related to big ideas such as: global German communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

DF26F30C2BD1438F87FF97B4D6C7E4AC.description: Produce a variety of oral non-fiction and fiction German texts to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

583BABDB1B6F483EB523780FCF56B35F.description: Share and justify emotional and personal reactions (e.g., empathy, surprise, appreciation, deference or disgust) to a variety of print texts.

9E9658F5F0CC49B5B7E3CF4A069223B4.description: React to written texts with questions of elaboration and alternate points of view.

0A343F97F7984397B0503AF2A04A9362.description: Analyze persuasive print texts (e.g., posters, graphs, charts and pictures) for bias.

43EC143E405C40BBBD9FB4F484AF4BFC.description: Discuss the theme and supporting elements of written texts.

E245427BA59843FB9D3D71A81CBED67B.description: Recount information in mass media texts using the “Konjunktiv I” tense and the passive voice (e.g., “Der Manager berichtet, er habe einen guten Plan, wie die Roughriders demnächst besser spielen werden.”).

60D6B91F48C84814B1DF01E30DE6EAD9.description: Summarize the message and details presented in a variety of formal and informal texts, such as: personal communication (e.g., letters, text messages, e-mails and social media posts); common business documents (e.g., confirmation of flight booking, receipts and invoices); media (e.g., articles, blogs and magazines); and, expository texts on various topics (e.g., historical events, environmental issues and political perspectives).

9FEAD61BEE7341AFB47158CCFDBB2B18.description: Follow multi-step directions to complete a task related to daily routines (e.g., following a recipe and finding a location).

C4967AF3C3A3467E8110FB40F8450F46.description: Comprehend information related to details about travel and transportation (e.g., tourist destinations, airports, cost and documentation requirements).

085F52A52E214589A4B47A446E12A9B9.description: Interpret signs and notices in public venues (e.g., signs for destinations, description of amenities and hazard warnings).

6110D1C8344948EE8CB0E65ABDB3B3A1.description: Analyze the intended purpose and audience of written texts.

08DC5EEDC41A433EA79104289CDB244E.description: Select, listen to and view a variety of written German texts (e.g., bibliographies, magazine articles, travel guides, editorials and poems) that address big ideas such as: global German communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

3288BE02E7754403A0D97D3D043C3FCC.description: Construct meaning of a variety of written non-fiction and fiction German texts to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

F9194F2826D445038E4FFA96EB736AA8.description: Investigate the source and credibility of statements made in reported speech.

610FE45722294C37845161243ED3F6BD.description: Analyze different nuances, perspectives and biases presented in oral texts.

6E063AB0CC9F436BA9651E1F1FFA9F20.description: Paraphrase the main message and supporting details presented in a variety of news reports (e.g., social media, television and radio) that include eyewitness accounts.

76DE050744624F27AB4AE8C964837838.description: Examine the vocabulary and expressions used in oral persuasive texts (e.g., advertisements and public service announcements).

6BED4A43EDAF44D59990935903727B61.description: Follow a series of instructions on familiar topics (e.g., playing a game and following a recipe).

B9ACAAA9E2C841EBBDAF07AFAEABACFE.description: Interpret directions and announcements related to travel (e.g., flight numbers and train departure times).

C7CBA3AF918A4AF9B6FE0404B8A42797.description: Analyze the intended purpose and audience of oral texts.

0DF01EB1BC574FD3A56D97E48382E243.description: Follow changes in topics during conversations on familiar topics.

6B45AB5713564E95B3CD6AA82FA9E5C2.description: Discuss information presented in documentaries and formal presentations on a variety of topics such as social issues, workplace diversity, political perspectives, environmental and climate issues and historical events.

63837C159C6A4ED4BD2EFFD6CC5ABE50.description: Respond appropriately in spontaneous conversations on familiar themes and daily activities.

F8EABADD732E449C976307567EB8972E.description: Select, listen to and view a variety of oral German texts (e.g., interviews, documentaries, podcasts, and movies) that address big ideas such as: global German communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

381EFD4EF067423A82C2A29E0A1F935F.description: Construct meaning of a variety of oral non-fiction and fiction German texts to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

4730BFEC09674FF893379C1FAA14560C.description: Employ genetive prepositions such as während, wegen, trotz, innerhalb, außerhalb, aufgrund, (an)statt (e.g., “Während des Tages muss ich mein Buch zu Ende lesen.”).

4CF1612ED658414DBF976016BD7D844C.description: Enhance writing with descriptions using adjective endings in the “nominative case” with both strong and weak endings (e.g., “Der kleine Tiger und ein kleiner Bär wohnten in einem Haus.”).

2828CEB0BAF34A04941D2DD9923EA0EE.description: Experiment with a variety of tenses in oral and written texts, including: future tense, using “werden” as well as the present tense (e.g., “Ich schwimme am Freitag.”, “Ich werde am Freitag schwimmen.”); plusquamperfect to establish the order of events in the past (e.g., “Ich habe mein Mittag gegessen, als ich Hunger gehabt hatte.”, “Wenn es wieder warm ist, will ich sofort draußen am See schwimmen.” and “Ich habe eine Suppe bestellt, als ich ins Restaurant gegangen war.”); past perfect tense in recounting personal experiences (e.g., “Als ich in Berlin angekommen bin, habe ich den Tiergarten besucht.”); imperfect and narrative past in telling fictional stories (e.g., “Der kleine Bär ging jeden Tag angeln.” and “Der kleine Bär und der kleine Tiger wohnten in einem gemütlichen Haus am Fluss. ”); and, ‘reported speech’ texts using Konjunktiv I tense (e.g., “Die Frau sagt, sie habe es gut gefunden.”).

5413173CC75145FB9685BAC34B0403CD.description: Employ the following German language conventions consistently in oral and written texts: accusative and dative adjective endings (e.g., “Sie haben eine große Mauer aus dickem Beton im 1961 in Berlin gebaut.”); relative pronouns and conjunctions with accurate word order (e.g., “Ich habe ein Sweatshirt am Alexanderplatz für meine Schwester gekauft, weil sie es zum Geburtstag gewünscht hat.”); and, modal verbs with accurate word order (e.g., “Wenn es wieder warm ist, will ich sofort draußen am See schwimmen.”).

ED644E86BB5D4C8FBF7C1B7CC206EAF7.description: Apply conventional verb-preposition pairings (e.g., Feste Verbindungen – “Ich denke an dich”).

87F0F64C90054CC7B9348DD8047774D8.description: Create a variety of oral and written texts spontaneously on a variety of topics.

55E9F81D9B33471E9B6329AFCA3A5D17.description: Express meaning using typical gestures, intonation, emphasis and German idioms.

91697CB7AE2A41E6B8E8E8C61844AAC8.description: Substitute one word or phrase with another in a meaningful way.

EE87C78EDE294E81BA3712E3DC05F3EC.description: Demonstrate, when producing oral and written texts, knowledge of German language concepts including vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

18D141D2062D482DA5189A2EE3FC31CF.description: Analyze the meaning of German idiomatic expressions.

2DEF2B9F73C04A91890726CFE66743C6.description: Explore German language conventions, including: accusative and dative adjective endings; relative pronouns and conjunctions; genitive prepositions; and, modal verbs.

CFF9F1CC0D6743158FD4AB05F3652F46.description: Identify passive voice, genitive expressions and idioms.

6FA6D2B67C754594B533C05FC48BA506.description: Comprehend the role of personal pronouns (e.g., nominative, accusative, dative and genitive).

84A2C254B51E4EFFB4A6A13CEAD0701E.description: Analyze causal relationship within sentences, as conferred through conjunctions and relative pronouns.

DDE04D1FD0AE48EFA9B5D475DE82AA74.description: Identify etymological roots of words in German and English.

9DC7C0E5172F4245B2031CB48FE94C65.description: Recognize extended range of vocabulary in personal, public and mass media texts (e.g., 750 sight words).

60724D5275BD4DF88895BDDFF6A2A01B.description: Demonstrate, when interpreting oral and written texts, knowledge of German language concepts including vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

E71BC95EBA904CCE9F80E9EE4A19A4DB.description: Develop interests, passion and confidence in learning German by: maintaining a positive learning attitude; taking the initiative to use German whenever possible; and, actively engaging in activities that help to enhance language proficiency.

87C22837EBF641BDA9C6779DF4EE1698.description: Maintain a learning log to: reflect on personal German writing or speaking process; evaluate personal written and oral production of language; assess which language learning strategies are most effective; and, describe ways in which risk-taking furthered personal language learning.

4B68A161413646DF81F5D53D223C8523.description: Employ cues (e.g., first, second and finally) to orient the audience in a longer text.

E718D200BAC0448191BF5FCD2A5F5ADA.description: Apply language learning strategies to support the production of written text, such as: taking risks; using cultural references (e.g., idioms, customs, traditions and perspectives); and, activating prior knowledge, etymology and cognates for personal expression in German.

87663FD577A941329A8DF1A5B3290B3A.description: Employ oral communication and mediation strategies such as: taking risks; applying prior knowledge and cognates for personal expression in German; using physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., laughter, tone and volume) cues to convey meaning; practising tongue-twisters to build fluency; demonstrating appropriate German etiquette in interactions; and, paraphrasing the message in different ways to clarify intent.

71554FADA00345BB8E532A3FE135D1FB.description: Devise tools (e.g., charts, phrasebooks and audio files) and select resources (e.g., electronic applications and grammar reference books) to support the production of oral and written texts.

10F011D0C50845439FE2637AC6140771.description: Create a plan for speaking or writing using tools such as a bullet journal and a narrative writing organizer.

E1938B6526BD4B20870D5AFC10A2DCDB.description: Select and apply a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct and communicate meaning when writing and speaking.

57091D096A8345CB982E24D39000F286.description: Use the German language to communicate with German-speaking people in a variety of situations.

2200B587F2524EE28286643C820465CB.description: Select and apply a variety of strategies to produce oral and written texts in German and reflect on personal language learning.

C3AB751F9C404FA593CF9C9B6E9F2FD5.description: Reflect on, and evaluate, personal viewing, listening and reading strategies.

A650255CA6B2478AAD5CA67E9B23283C.description: Discuss the effectiveness of strategies used to address challenges of learning an additional language.

804127B3770C4BAF9C499529A778F905.description: Maintain a learning log to evaluate personal comprehension of language and assess which language learning strategies are most effective.

8E49DBA93CB7489CAD0051AD823AA8E3.description: Identify similarities and differences in sentence structures between the English and German languages.

9C109B7F0F684E6087D937EA3C0AC2BF.description: Pose questions to examine the intent of a message presented in a text.

06B580CDA96844FB8B560887A9703FDA.description: Apply language learning strategies such as: using supplementary information (e.g., prior research, background knowledge and glossaries); interpreting physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., tone, laughter and volume) cues; examining context clues and key words to infer the intent of the message; recognizing roots of words to deconstruct their meaning; identifying cognates from English (e.g., kochen – Koch) or from another language (e.g., Eis – ice / ice cream) to decipher words; using phonics and generalizations to decode individual and compound words; and  looking for patterns and relationships of sentences to interpret meanings of messages.

A046EF7966044AFC8CE0C3349DBF9F55.description: Develop tools (e.g., charts, phrasebooks and audio files) and select resources (e.g., electronic applications and grammar reference books) to help construct meaning of oral and written text.

F9455AF33DC144558FCFB7A8B94AA11A.description: Prepare to interpret oral and written texts using language learning strategies such as developing predictions and analyzing purpose and context.

94530016B3F44798B11E35737D23D7A4.description: Select and apply a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct meaning when listening, viewing and reading.

7723A8AED8E54C93AB339145EA0B5A48.description: Select and apply a variety of strategies to interpret oral and written texts in German and reflect on personal language learning.
